data.question: What method is used for the synthesis of larger metallacarboranes, and who developed it?
data.answer: Polyhedral expansion method developed by Hawthorne is used for the synthesis of larger metallacarboranes.

data.question: What was the outcome of treating the starting material 2,3-(CH2)3-2,3-C2B12H12 with finely cut sodium metal in THF at room temperature?
data.answer: The outcome was the formation of 14-vertex nido-carborane salt [{(CH2)3C2B12H12}{Na2(thf)4}]n (3) isolated in 80% yield.

data.question: What reaction conditions failed to produce 15-vertex carborane but successfully generated a 15-vertex metallacarborane?
data.answer: The reactions of Na2-nido-[(CH2)3C2B12H12] with different borane reagents RBX2 under various conditions failed to produce 15-vertex carborane but successfully generated a 15-vertex metallacarborane.

data.question: What was the yield of 15-vertex ruthenacarborane 1,4-(CH2)3-7-(p-cymene)-7,1,4-RuC2B12H12 (4) and how was it obtained?
data.answer: The 15-vertex ruthenacarborane 1,4-(CH2)3-7-(p-cymene)-7,1,4-RuC2B12H12 (4) was obtained in 62% yield after column chromatographic separation by reacting 3 with 0.5 equivalents of [{(p-cymene)-RuCl2}2] in THF.

data.question: How does the reducing power of nido-carborane dianions relate to the cluster size according to the text?
data.answer: The reducing power of nido-carborane dianions increases with increasing cluster size.

data.question: What was the result of the reaction between Na2-5 a and 0.5 equivalents of [{(p-cymene)-RuCl2}2] in THF?
data.answer: The reaction between Na2-5 a and 0.5 equivalents of [{(p-cymene)-RuCl2}2] in THF led to 5 a and 5 b in a ratio similar to that mentioned above after column chromatographic separation.

data.question: What is the relationship between the synthesis of 15-vertex carboranes/metallacarboranes and the stability of [B14H14]2- and [B15H15]2-?
data.answer: The synthesis of 15-vertex carboranes/metallacarboranes was inspired by theoretical calculations suggesting similar stability of [B14H14]2- and [B15H15]2-, leading to the exploration of cage-opening followed by boron or metal insertion to prepare 15-vertex clusters.

data.question: Why was the reaction of 3 with different reagents under various conditions unable to produce 15-vertex carborane?
data.answer: The reaction of 3 with different reagents under various conditions was unable to produce 15-vertex carborane due to the high reducing power of the nido-carborane dianion, which prevented its capitation with HBBr2Â·SMe2.

data.question: What indicates the high symmetry of 5 a compared to 5 b based on their 11B{1H} NMR spectra?
data.answer: The 11B{1H} NMR spectrum of 5 a displayed a 3:3:3:2 pattern, whereas that of 5 b showed a 1:1:2:1:1:1:1:2:1 pattern, indicating that 5 a has higher symmetry.

data.question: How does the structure of 4 compare to the predicted structure of [B15H15]2-?
data.answer: The structure of 4 adopts a closo structure with 26 triangular faces and has approximate D3h symmetry, very similar to the predicted structure of [B15H15]2-.

data.question: What role does the {(p-cymene)Ru} fragment play in the formation of the 15-vertex species?
data.answer: The {(p-cymene)Ru} fragment is crucial for the formation of the 15-vertex species, as reactions with other reagents under various conditions failed to produce the 15-vertex carborane, indicating the unique role of the {(p-cymene)Ru} fragment.

data.question: What was the significance of the reaction conditions in the synthesis of 14- and 15-vertex ruthenacarboranes?
data.answer: The reaction conditions were significant in the synthesis of 14- and 15-vertex ruthenacarboranes as they determined the success in obtaining these clusters, highlighting the importance of preventing redox reactions to achieve larger clusters.

data.question: True or False: The synthesis of 15-vertex carboranes was directly achieved by reacting Na2-nido-[(CH2)3C2B12H12] with borane reagents.
True or False: The 15-vertex ruthenacarborane 1,4-(CH2)3-7-(p-cymene)-7,1,4-RuC2B12H12 (4) is one of the largest metallacarboranes known.
True or False: The reducing power of nido-carborane dianions decreases with increasing cluster size.
True or False: Complex 4 is unstable in air and insoluble in polar organic solvents.
True or False: The reaction of Na2-5 a with 0.5 equivalents of [{(p-cymene)-RuCl2}2] in THF resulted in the formation of 4.
True or False: The 11B{1H} NMR spectrum of 5 a and 5 b indicates that both have the same level of symmetry.
True or False: The synthesis of 15-vertex carboranes/metallacarboranes was not influenced by the theoretical stability of [B14H14]2- and [B15H15]2-.
